subject: Maintaining records for various ROW permission against underground utilities.
text: 9r4 7cfl TTTHTf ufaarvt {9 Phone 91-11-25074100/75074200 (m 4dt, F3+ 4Rd7 &< TTHT T7TT4) #JA /Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QA#. {Extn:: 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) 0-5 W 6, 042t-10, ETIT, 7F farah-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No : 11041/21/2002-Admn: December 7 2005 POLICY MATTERS: TECHNICAL (60/2005) [Decision taken On CM Division file No, NHAUCMRROGEN/2OOS] Sub: Maintaining Records for various ROW Permissions against underground utilities. A number of permission cases of various agencies are being received from PIUsICMUs lo underground utilities like OFC, electric cables, waterlseweragelgas pipelines etc within NH ROW: It has been observed that in general, the proposals are simply forwarded by field units without taking much care cf the proper and planned allotment of the blank spaces Though Ministry has already issued directions for maintaining the records Of ROW permissions as per its letter No. RWINH- 33044/17/2000-S&R dated 23rd  July 2003 (copy enclosed) it is observed that not much serious aclion has been taken by the field units and updated data is not able on the various permissions granted so far by NHAI or earlier authorities within NH ROW: To ensure proper utilization of  blank spaces and to avoid  overcrowding overlapping a8 well 8 to ensure laying of utilities in a planned way, the Competent Authority has directed that all PIUsICMUs shall immediately: a) Prepare and maintain ilinear strip plans of NH within their jurisdictions showing various utilities permitted by the PIUICMU till date clearly specifying endlstart or crossing chainages. The linear plan shall be prepared for each km depicting various  utilities in different forms colours, The agencies and other  details should be maintained in the format enclosed at Annexure A, These should be continuously updated. For all future cases of permissions, PDs would require to submit the strip plan details of the existing utilities for respective chainages for which he has recommended to another utility: In case no utility exists, PD would require to submit a certificate for the same b) Collect required details for utilities existing prior to NHAI taking over of a NH, from PWDs/DPRs Or other sources 35 applicable &d should incorporate the same in the linear plan A strict compliance of the directions may please be ensureland report submitted by 16.01,.2006.
